titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Thorney and Jemima Frost Craft marriage certificate 1979.005
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:13:46 +0000.

did.unittitle: Robert Thorney and Jemima Frost Craft marriage certificate
did.abstract: Marriage certificate of Robert Thorney Craft and Jemima Frost of Queens County, signed by Cadwallader Colden, Lieutenant Governor and Commander in Chief of the Province of New York under King George III. The certificate is dated 1764. Robert Thorney Craft was a joiner by trade.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Robert Thorney and Jemima Frost Craft marriage certificate, 1979.005, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.
